intro: Silene colorata subsp. colorata, commonly known as the showy campion, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring simple, alternate leaves that are lance-shaped and hairy. The plant produces striking pink to red flowers in clusters at the ends of its stems, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in meadows, roadsides, and disturbed habitats. Its showy flowers attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies, making it a valuable addition to gardens and natural landscapes.
